=== Statistical Analysis ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

T-test for maximum score difference:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Mean score (No CRE): 17.11 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Mean score (CRE): 31.34 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Difference: 14.22 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  p-value: 2.0183e-05 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Wilcoxon rank-sum test:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  p-value: 5.6508e-06 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Logistic Regression Results:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = cre_infection ~ max_score, family = binomial(), 
    data = score_cre_analysis)

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept) -1.89910    0.32374  -5.866 4.46e-09 ***
max_score    0.04854    0.01110   4.371 1.23e-05 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 197.24  on 157  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 174.60  on 156  degrees of freedom
AIC: 178.6

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Odds Ratio per unit increase in max score: 1.05 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
95% CI: 1.028 - 1.074 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

THERAPY PARADOX ANALYSIS
```

```
Why do treated patients have worse outcomes?
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
============================================
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

=== Preparing Data ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

=== The Paradox ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Simple Comparison (MISLEADING):
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 5
  ever_received_therapy     n mean_score infection_rate therapy_label   
                  <dbl> <int>      <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>           
1                     0   123       16.8          0.228 No Therapy      
2                     1    35       38.7          0.629 Received Therapy
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

⚠️ PARADOX: Treated patients have HIGHER infection rates!
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
But notice: Treated patients also have HIGHER risk scores
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

```

=== Regression Analysis Adjusting for Score ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Unadjusted Model (misleading):
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Therapy coefficient: 1.748 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Therapy OR: 5.74 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Interpretation: Therapy appears harmful 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Adjusted Model (accounting for risk score):
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Therapy coefficient: 1.084 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Therapy OR: 2.96 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Score coefficient: 0.036 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Interpretation: After adjusting for risk, therapy is harmful 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

=== Exploring Timing Issues ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Timing Analysis (for patients with therapy and infection):
  Therapy given BEFORE infection: 4 
  Therapy given AFTER infection: 18 

⚠️ WARNING: Some therapy was given AFTER infection!
This could explain the paradox - therapy given in response to infection
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}

EXPLAINING THE PARADOX
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
============================================
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

1. WHY THE PARADOX OCCURS:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Confounding by indication: Sicker patients get treatment
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Higher risk patients → More likely to receive therapy
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Higher risk patients → More likely to get infected
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Creates spurious association between therapy and infection
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

2. KEY FINDINGS:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Unadjusted analysis: Therapy appears HARMFUL 
   • After adjusting for risk: Therapy appears HARMFUL 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

3. CLINICAL IMPLICATIONS:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Cannot evaluate therapy effectiveness without accounting for baseline risk
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • The scoring system is working: High-risk patients get therapy
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Need risk-adjusted analysis or RCT to determine true effectiveness
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

4. RECOMMENDATIONS:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   a) For analysis:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Always adjust for baseline risk score
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Consider propensity score methods
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Check timing of therapy vs infection
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   b) For clinical practice:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Current practice appropriately targets high-risk patients
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Consider randomized trial for definitive evidence
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      - Monitor outcomes within risk strata
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

5. ALTERNATIVE EXPLANATIONS TO CONSIDER:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Therapy ineffectiveness: The specific therapy may not work
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Timing issues: Therapy given too late
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Resistance: CRE strains resistant to therapy used
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Dose/duration: Suboptimal therapy regimen
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   • Therapy heterogeneity: Different therapy types used
     - Type 1 used: 24 times
     - Type 2 used: 18 times
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
